intro: Tapiphyllum vestitum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its rapid growth, it is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
